conclusion: To solve the problem, calculate the change in magnetic flux as the coil rotates 60°.
Formula for magnetic flux: Φ = B · A · cos(θ).
Initial area A_initial is 0.4 m², B = 0.1 T in positive x-direction, θ initially 0°.
Calculate initial magnetic flux: Φ_initial = 0.1 · 0.4 · 1 = 0.04 Wb.
Calculate final magnetic flux: Φ_final = 0.1 · 0.4 · cos(30°) = 0.03464 Wb.
Change in magnetic flux ΔΦ = Φ_final - Φ_initial = -0.00536 Wb.
The change in magnetic flux is -0.00536 Wb.
